Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Scarab
Description: Skilfully fashioned small blue scarab with its eyes, head and clypeus, prothorax and elytra depicted. The legs are crenellated. The inscription is frequently used during the 12th Dynasty and 13th Dynasty: the prophylactic signs of the offering table, clump of papyrus and the nefer sign.
